textos_fuente.text: Katya Vineyards - Tallen Builders 352.629.0377 About Us Our Process Giving Back Services Luxury Home Building Commercial Construction Equine Facilities Tenant Build Out Design Build Portfolio Current Projects Residential Commercial Equine Facility Renovations/Additions/TI Testimonials News Contact Careers Become a Subcontractor Katya Vineyards Located in the beautiful area of Downtown Ocala we worked on this interior remodel for the Katya Vineyards.  A little over 1200 sq ft this Wine Bar and Tasting Room is an upscale elegant retail venue to showcase and sell their wine. They also have a small area for business meetings. The Vineyards Tasting Room kept the original ambiance of the Castro Building with the brick arches and dark tile floor similar to the entry way, with a few upgrades of their own. https://katyavineyards.com/ Architect: J Snell Daniels Designs https://www.jsnelldaniels.com/ Engineer: Riddle Consulting Engineers http://www.riddleengineering.com/ Share this post Share to Facebook Share to Twitter Share to LinkedIn Share via Email CGC#: 1517539 Services Luxury Home Building Commercial Construction Equine Facilities Tenant Build Out Design Build Links About Us Services Portfolio Testimonials Our Process Giving Back News Become a Subcontractor Contact Get in Touch Tallen Builders LLC 2531 NW 35th Street Ocala, Florida 34475 Phone 352.629.0377 Fax 352.690.6335 Email sallen@tallenbuilders.com © 2025 Tallen Builders . Kaya Vineyard & Winery | Dahlonega GA Wines, Cottages & Weddings Home Shop kayavineyards kayavineyards Tasting locations Wine Club Become a Member FAQ Weddings & Events Event Team Property Gallery FAQ Recommended Vendors List Dining Our Menu Picnic Baskets Events Cottages All Cottages OUR 360 TOUR About kayavineyards Contact Us BOOK NOW BOOK NOW BOOK NOW Home Shop kayavineyards kayavineyards Tasting locations Wine Club Become a Member FAQ Weddings & Events Event Team Property Gallery FAQ Recommended Vendors List Dining Picnic Baskets Our Menu Events Cottages OUR 360 TOUR All Cottages About About Kaya Vineyards Contact Us BOOK NOW BOOK NOW The Largest Winery in Dahlonega, Georgia KAYA VINEYARD AND WINERY an estate of it's own About Kaya Vineyard & Winery Kaya Vineyards and Winery was one of the first and largest of the current vineyards in the Dahlonega area. The winery, built upon the apex of a ridge topping a 1,600-foot elevation, offers exquisite mountain views and incomparable vineyard views from its tasting room. Enjoy sweeping views of the Blue Ridge Mountains in the panorama of lush vineyards, while experiencing some of the best wines in the Southeast. OUR WINES A black line is being drawn on a white background. PAY US A VISIT Kaya Vineyard A black line is being drawn on a white background. AN OUTDOOR PARADISE LUXURY COTTAGES Spend an unforgettable time in one our newly established Craftsman style cottages right in the best location in all of Georgia. VIEW COTTAGES EAT + DRINK TASTING ROOM Farm-to-table, fine dining, and always fresh. Find our favorite restaurants for any occasion. EXPLORE LOCATIONS LEAVE EVERYTHING TO US WEDDINGS Host your wedding at Kaya Vineyards WEDDINGS AT KAYA A black line is being drawn on a white background. REVIEWS What Our Visitors Say A black line is being drawn on a white background. "Kaya is wonderful. It was the venue of my wedding, and it has fantastic scenery, a great environment, and a wonderful staff. Oh yeah, and the wine is really, really, really good!" Matthew Buscher "My husband and I visited Kaya Vineyard this past weekend and had the best time! The views are stunning, the facility is gorgeous and clean, and the staff were all knowledgeable and friendly. All the wines were sampled were delicious, and we had the best tasting Pimento Cheese sandwich (which tasted even better after a few glases- ha). If you are in the Atlanta area, do yourself a visit and plan an outing at Kaya Vineyard and Winery!" Jade Summers Green "First time to Kaya Vineyard and enjoyed the wine tasting, excellent service, beautiful view of the vineyard and Blue Ridge mountains!" Ken Rempert "Kaya is wonderful. It was the venue of my wedding, and it has fantastic scenery, a great environment, and a wonderful staff. Oh yeah, and the wine is really, really, really good!" Matthew Buscher 2023 Dahlonega Discovery Guide Check out the new 2023 Discovery Guide to help plan your visit! VIEW THE GUIDE VIRTUAL EXPERIENCE Destination Tours Your virtual tour is open. About Us – SlavicBeauty.net Skip to content (323) 522-5881 info@slavicbeauty.net 0 0 / $0.00 Products Dairy Cream separators Cream separator spare parts Coolers Milking units Butter churns and pasteurizers Plevnik-Cheese Making Equipment Cheese Making Equipment Prepresses Presses Cheese Tables Cheese Moulds Salting Vat Cheese Washing Machine Cheese Cutting Device Container Dairy Solutions Brochures Send Inquiry Bird and Wildlife Deterrents - Propane Cannon Other products Refurbished and specials Slavic Beauty gift card Books Blog Recipies FAQs References About Us Contact Us About Us Who We Are My name is Katya Luniova, and with my family, we run a small US-based business since 2003. We are happy to offer you high-quality and unique products for a healthy and simple lifestyle. Our company has grown from a hobby to a full-fledged business. I am lucky to have a loving husband who shares my enthusiasm and passion. My two beautiful children are always happy to help with photos and videos. My devoted friends are ready at all times to test our new equipment in their own homestead and give us their honest feedback. We are a small team working on a big dream. We listen and understand the needs of our clients. We learn a lot from our clients; their feedback enriches us with new ideas and inspires us to improve. I was born and raised in Ukraine, a picturesque country where traditions live. Since early childhood, I was always curious about watching a process, whether it was milking a cow or a miracle of turning white fresh milk into a savory yellow cheese. I was amazed to watch my grandparents, who seemed to know everything and could do just about anything using things at hand and what nature gave them. Being charmed by a simple lifestyle, I always tried to mark and remember our home recipes and secrets. Later on, I became fascinated with the idea to share my family and country heirloom traditions and connect my business with what I have always been most passionate about. The Internet really makes it a small world. One can learn about the lifestyle of different people around the planet. I am a member of many homestead and hobby farming forums. It is nice to be a part of the community where people turn their minds to better living habits, the use of natural resources, and consuming fresh and healthy food. We are proud that the products we offer can become great helpers to maintain a healthy lifestyle. We hope SlavicBeauty Youtube channel videos will provide helpful information on using a cream separator or making cream cheese or butter. We create an ongoing SlavicBeauty blog . The primary intention of our blog is to help you with any step in using your new device or to share a great recipe. Why choose SlavicBeauty Our strength comes from honest collaboration with our clients. You are our most important asset. You are the lifeblood of our company, after all. We are happy to provide you support at every stage of the purchasing cycle and long after the purchase is completed. We are here not just to sell but to stay with you afterward. How SlavicBeauty Stays Connected We keep you informed about our company’s innovations and events through SlavicBeauty social media pages: Instagram , Youtube , Facebook , Twitter . Our business is entirely online, but we understand the importance of personal meetings and seeing the product in real life. Since 2012 SlavicBeauty takes part in different shows and expos, such as World Dairy Expo , EuroTier , Mother Earth News Fair , and others. How To Contact SlavicBeauty We are happy to offer you outstanding customer service. We are always in touch and ready to provide a tailored solution based on a situation. SlavicBeauty Contact Us page. We genuinely believe that our approach and how we treat our clients make our company stand out in the marketplace. How We Deliver SlavicBeauty Products We ship most of our products from our US warehouses which means that United States residents can receive them very quickly thanks to proven carriers such as  UPS, FedEx, USPS  Most of the products ship free inside the US and for an additional charge can be shipped around the world. We ship worldwide. Customer Service We believe strongly in providing the best customer service possible so that you get the product you want in a timely fashion. Our friendly, courteous staff is here to explain about the products we offer and answer your questions as well. We understand that our reputation is only as good as our last customer. We strive every day to do the best we can so that you can enjoy our products. SLAVIC BEAUTY EXPOS Vist booth AL 116 to see the quality dairy equipment for small herds by SlavicBeauty. October 3-7, 2017Both, AL 116 Visit our new location booth AL 116 to see SlavicBeauty cream separators, goat milkers, cow milkers and butter churns at World Dairy Expo 2016. We look forward to be a part of WDE for the 5th consecutive year. Madison, WI October 4-8, 2016Booth AL 116 Slavic Beauty, distributor of quality dairy equipmen participated in the 2012 World Dairy Expo in Madison, Wisconsin. Booth AL 134 Slavic Beauty, distributor of quality dairy equipment took part in the 2013 World Dairy Expo in Madison, Wisconsin. Booth AL 134 Slavic Beauty, distributor of quality dairy equipment participated in the 2014 World Dairy Expo on September 30 – October 4 in Madison, Wisconsin. Booth AL 134 Slavic Beauty, distributor of quality dairy equipment, took part in the 2015 World Dairy Expo on September 29 – October 3 in Madison, Wisconsin. Stand AL 134 Slavic Beauty showcased cream separators, butter churns and mini milkers in stand # F11 at the Northern Michigan Small Farm Conference January 30, 2016 • Grand Traverse Resort. Stand F11 SlavicBeauty is happy to return to EuroTier – The world’s leading trade fair for animal production this year and showcase mini dairy equipment for small dairy farmers and homesteaders. Hannover, Germany 15-18 November, 2016Booth 13-D64 SlavicBeauty mini dairy equipment at Mother Earth News Fair West Bend, Wis July 9-10 2016 Booth 1605 SlavicBeauty cream separators, cows milkers, goat and sheep mini milking machines and butter churns at Mother Earth News Fair, Seven Springs, PA September 23-25 2016 Booth #2304 Slavic Beauty showcased high quality cream separators, milk analyzers and incubators at EuroTier – the world’s leading trade fair for animal production in Hanover from 11 to 14 November 2014. Hanover from 11 to 14 November 2014. Katya Vineyards wins Golden Spoon, fourth winner for Ocala Man stabbed to death in NW Marion; detectives search for possible person of interest News Sports Entertainment Lifestyle Advertise Obituaries eNewspaper Legals BUSINESS Katya Vineyards wins Golden Spoon, fourth winner for Ocala Carlos E. Medina Ocala Star-Banner Ocala gained another Golden Spoon Award-winning restaurant this year when Katya Vineyard s received the coveted honor. The fine-dining awards, bestowed by Florida Trend magazine for some 50 years, recognized Katya on its first year of eligibility. "We're very honored to be selected. We did not anticipate we would win. We're very happy," said David Sokol, founder and owner of the restaurant, located at 101 E. Silver Springs Blvd. With Katya's selection, Ocala is now home to four Golden Spoon restaurants. The others are La Cuisine, Sky Fine Dining and Craft Cuisine. It was one of the owners of Ocala's first Golden Spoon Hall of Fame restaurant who first told Sokol of the award. Looking for a free mini puzzle? Play the USA TODAY Quick Cross now. More: 25 things you should avoid doing when dining at a fancy restaurant "Elodie Perron of La Cuisine called us to tell us she saw we made the list," he said. "Patrice (Perron) came by and we shared a glass of wine to celebrate. That's the nice thing about Ocala. The restaurateurs support each other." Only 125 restaurants in the state earned a Golden Spoon. Sky earned its 11th award and Craft Cuisine earned a third spoon after receiving its first as one of the best new restaurants in 2018. Both of those restaurants are temporarily closed. Craft Cuisine owners Webster and Fatima Luzuriaga previously said the layout of the restaurant would not allow them to operate under social-distancing guidelines. Sky is closed for remodeling and will reopen in a few weeks, according to owner Danny Gaekwad. David and Patricia Sokol opened Katya in 2017 as a small tasting room and wine bar that featured some of the wine produced at their vineyard. "We had a very small space. I think about 1,200 square feet," David Sokol said. Katherine Sokol Deras, the couple's daughter, serves as managing director. She married executive chef Antonio Deras, who is responsible for the ever-changing menu. The restaurant's menu does not follow a particular style, and Sokol describes it as international gourmet. More: As winter weather approaches, restaurants get creative with outdoor dining "Antonio changes more than half of that menu every week and Katherine, who is studying to be a sommelier, matches the wines to the flavor profile of the food," Sokol said. "It's a true family effort." While they expanded, the location is still cozy at only about 2,500 square feet. "I don't know how Tony does what he does in such a small kitchen. I tell you, it's not much bigger than a food truck kitchen," Sokol said. "It feels so go that we can all work together and not kill each other and still win a Golden Spoon." — Contact Carlos E. Medina at cmedina@starbanner.com or 234-4787.
